reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is an actual American reviewing this
reviews.reviewText: Works well for socks, undies, kitchen towels, T shirts, smaller or thin stuff. One cycle to wash with soap, drain and replace water to rinse. Then drain again and spin in the basket. Hang dry or throw in the actual dryer. Compact and a great purchase for quick, small stuff. Seems to be built well too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The product is very nice. Made well. Unfortunately not very strong. Even with a very light item. Washing is very light, had to do 2 washes. It would actually just be for lingerie in my opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cool portable washer
reviews.reviewText: I received this today to take in my camper I tried washing socks and underwear it worked really well,it even has a little basket to spin the water out. It folds up like an accordion when you are done using it it definitely is pretty neat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Worked well for for the first month
reviews.reviewText: Don’t waste your money! It did work well in the beginning for the first month. Month & 1/2. Now sounds like the motor is going every time I try to use it it sounds like a grinding noise and then it flashes lights & stops. It’s too much money to spend on something paper weight and past the window or return😡

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It wobbles way too much. Not sure if I had too much in it (2 shirts and a bout 4 pair of socks) but i set it on the counter and it wobbled so much that it would walk right off the counter if you didn't watch it close. I stopped and tried balancing the load several times, but it just got right out of balance again. It is a powerful little machine though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars My granddaughter uses for her Barbie clothes & such.
reviews.reviewText: I was super excited to get this automatic washing machine thinking that it would actually be able to fit maybe one pair of pants or a couple shirts, but no. I'm not a large woman either, but there is no way my pants are fitting in there! It's actually a really nice washer. Functionally, it works well. Had it been twice the size as the basket is now, I would have been super happy. I feel like they could have easily done that without much difficulty actually. There's no way that I'm hauling this thing around with me to be able to wash two pairs of underwear and a few pairs of sock. So I gave it to my granddaughter. It just so happened that she had asked me for Christmas, a kids pretend watching machine for her Barbies. So, when she got the real thing... she was over the moon happy! Now she is the envy of all her friends and they all can't wait to come spend the night and be able to wash their Barbies clothes too!So although it didn't work out for my uses because of the basket size, I've got a very happy 9 year old granddaughter & friends; that are joyfully learning to do laundry with her Barbie's clothes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set-up, stable and works great!
reviews.reviewText: We ordered this 7 L capacity portable washing machine for us to use at our vacation home and we really like that it’s quite portable and not heavy to carry at only 16.3 LB. Our son was able to readily and easily get all the connecting parts and installed it and in less than 30 minutes this mini portable washer was really to be used.We do like that it comes with a lot of great features; the spin dry, the automatic water inflow and drainage, and the triple anti- scalding displacement system. My favorite things about this durable and reliable washer are the fully automatic system, the quiet operation, even when placed on a countertop or table top, and the precise temperature control. We have been washing with it for over the last 5 weeks now, and we do like that it’s pretty easy to use by following the simple instructions, comes with a bottom portable handle and mostly importantly, we are able to add clothes mid- way through the washing and it works great. I also do like that it does a good job of rinsing and cleaning after each wash. Considering the quality, the functionality and the price point, this mini washer with double door cover is definitely a great value for money. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice little fully automatic portable washer.
reviews.reviewText: This is a very impressive little washer! I have tried other small ones that honestly did not work very well, but that is not the case with this one, and this is my first time trying a little washer that is fully automatic. It is very small and you cannot wash very much at a time, but this would be great for a dorm, camper, cabin, or traveling. It is super easy to hook up and use, and the loads take 35 to 45 minutes.

Very Disappointed. The 9L 7.6LBS mini portable, folding, washing machine with spin dryer came the next day and was in perfect shape. The problem was the suction cups on the bottom of the machine didn't have enough suction power to allow the machine to be opened into operating position so I never got a chance to try the machine. Returned!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a decent job at washing nasty rags
reviews.reviewText: We use this exclusively to wash car rags. It works fine for each towels but a drying towel (think a jumbo beach mat) will overload it.The cleaner works surprisingly well for car rags. The agitation comes in the form of rotations and works quite well and cleaned up the rags nicely. Drying was a bit of an exercise in futility though: it didn't work well and I just gave up and used our actual dryer.

The media could not be loaded. It's not really practical or efficient. I started off testing it with 4 pairs of underwear and by the end It became painfully clear it could barely handle 1 pair. It's a neat Idea but the machine clearly doesn't have a very strong motor. When it came to the spin to wring out the water (done with only one pair), it couldn't get any of the water out of it because it was spinning so slow. It was too full of water to throw in the dryer or hang up so I ended up running it through my washer on a rinse and spin. I had hoped this would be good for a uniform shirt or a piece of clothing you need to wear repeatedly, (I had to sink wash before when living in an apartment with no wash facilities). I think this machine is extremely impractical and unless it had a much stronger motor not worth using
